reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you are used to typical brand-name toothbrushes, even the ones that say soft, this will take a little getting used to. This toothbrush head is smaller and it’s definitely very soft. But not too soft. I find it to clean my teeth well without irritating my gums. The quality is good and the brushes last a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very very soft
reviews.reviewText: Even though this is a very very soft toothbrush, it does the job it doesn't hurt your teeth or gums because there's thousands of bristles in this so it's very thick, I love it and will only use this toothbrush

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Neat, but weird.
reviews.reviewText: It feels strange. Like almost hurts? But it is super soft. It's hard to explain, but it's great for sensitive gums, but is almost like chewing foil on sensitive teeth..... they feel very clean afterward though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I just don't like the feel of this.
reviews.reviewText: It is super soft. It leaves my teeth very clean, but takes longer to brush. I just don't feel like I have actually brushed my teeth after using. It's just TOO soft. I feel like it really does remove plaque from the teeth, but I don't feel the same amount of clean after brushing. It's more like using a chamois cloth on your teeth. Hard to describe. Am going to use them on my cat, and give a couple to my mom who has gum issues. Good price, if you like the product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have braces and this tooth brush cleans teeth, yet its v,ery soft and soft on gums and teeth

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These toothbrushes have very, very fine bristles that get into places other toothbrushes can't get to- under the gums in particular. They are also very good for those with sensitive teeth and gums. Painful brushing makes one not want to brush their teeth properly, making dental health problems worse. These brushes are so soft they really feel very good, especially on and under the gums. These toothbrush bristles feel like the face brushes with the very fine bristles usually in a wavy pattern as well, except these bristles are finer. A great (and low cost) purchase for your oral health.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great on sore gums!
reviews.reviewText: I had to pull several teeth due to medical conditions. My gums were so sore and anything that I put on it other than gauze would bleed. So I found this online and saw that it had many great reviews. I’m so glad I did because this is been a lifesaver for me to get through this. Really soft and I’d like the covers that come with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Painless brushing and SO SUPER clean!!!
reviews.reviewText: More pros than cons👋🏼I have to start by saying i gave this inly 4 stars because its so soft it'll wear out pretty fast (probably needs replaced monthly) but I LOVE this toothbrush. I have had very healthy teeth my entire life, i didnt get my first cavity until after I had my first child. But ive since struggled finding a toothbrush soft enough for my gums. Even “sensitive” brand name toothbrushes would feel like sandpaper on my gums and I dreaded brushing my teeth. But this toothbrush changed everything. SO SOFT that I literally teared up when i used it because my brushing experience was so gentle. (Its a big deal to me lol)Im not sure if there are any better ones out there, this is the first one of the “nano” toothbrushes ive ever tried. It does go soft and the bristle spread flat pretty quickly since its SUCH a soft brush. But because of all those tiny bristles you get an exceptionally shiny clean. I have to emphasize just how clean this toothbrush gets your teeth! And ZERO pain.Honestly even if i have to buy this toothbrush twice as often as i used to its absolutely worth it to me hands down. Apparently you are supposed to replace your toothbrush every month anyways.... i never got that memo. But this tooth brush will probably only last about a month and then itll need replaced.I love it so much i bought one for our whole family. Our 3 kids range from 5-2 yrs and they all are in love with these tooth brushes!!!!! Worth it!
Cómprenlo para el cuidado de sus dientes

Me gusta lo suave que es no afecta para nada a las encías.Compre un pack de cuatro cepillos y uno de ellos lo utilizo para mi mascota.No puedo decir nada malo de éste producto.Sin duda lo volveré a comprar.

Wir haben diese Zahnbürste gekauft, weil jemand sehr empfindliche und schmerzende Zähne hatte und mit keiner anderen Bürste mehr putzen konnte. Diese Bürste ist so weich, dass putzen ganz ohne Schmerzen geklappt hat. Die Zähne brauchen viel länger um sauber zu werden, weil der Belag nicht "abgeschrubbt" wird, aber sie werden durchaus sauber. Die Bürste hält leider nicht sehr lange die Form. Für den alltäglichen Gebrauch würden wir sie nicht benutzen, aber wenn man so Schmerzen hat, dass eine "normale" Zahnbürste weh tut, ist sie super.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: Good value and very soft for sensitive gums/teeth
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for me and my boyfriend to try. We have been using the curved top black and white toothbrushes for about 5 days now. I am in love with it, my teeth and gums are very sensitive and I'm prone to mouth ulcers, but this tooth brush means you can brush your teeth and gums (it's important to brush your gums too!) without damaging them. I have found it takes a bit longer to brush your teeth as you have to go slower and in smaller motions with all the thin bristles. Its a different style of brushing your teeth to how im used to, but I always had a preference for soft brushes. My boyfriend isn't quite as keen as me, before this he always used hard bristle brushes. If you're used to/enjoy brushing with hard bristles then this may not be the brush for you, it feels more like you are polishing your teeth than actually brushing.I've attached a pic of my toothbrush after 5 days brushing. The bristles have separated a little bit but it doesn't effect the brushing, although it might indicate that this brush won't last as long. The second pic is what the packaging generally looks like, although it seems like you get the 2 curved brushes and the 2 flat top brushes from slightly different brands - their packaging is very similar though. Overall this is good value and a great alternative to the expensive 'silko' toothbrush I've been advertised.
